result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miquela Rosario Perez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Miquela Rosario Perez not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Miquela Rosario Perez.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 15.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Letter from defendant re:  extending probation w/no more incarceration.  (Miquela R. Perez - #2022009094, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Miquela Rosario Perez not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard by ZOOM.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Defense counsel recently appointed and has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review. Case remains calendared in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Court ordered no contact with C.J and K.W
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

10:13 AM Defendant Miquela Rosario Perez in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Miquela Rosario Perez in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial. 
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
This hearing may be streamed live through DACAST at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
